medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had a two-year history of atraumatic pain in the left shoulder, which was insidious in onset, diffuse, dull, nonradiating, and nonprogressive. She reported no pain at rest but experienced pain with any activity and at night, particularly when lying on her left side.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Neurofibromatosis-1 diagnosed at eight months of age; previous congenital pseudarthrosis of the tibia that required surgery. No current medications or allergies.
medical_history.family_history: Patient’s mother, maternal aunt, a male sibling, and two of the patient’s four children have neurofibromatosis-1.
medical_history.social_history: The patient is a nonsmoker and works as a cashier at a grocery store.
